text: Poor Things is a 2023 erotic black comedy movie directed by Yorgos Lanthimos and written by Tony McNamara. It is based on the 1992 novel by Alasdair Gray. The movie stars Emma Stone, Mark Ruffalo, Willem Dafoe, Ramy Youssef, Christopher Abbott, and Jerrod Carmichael. The movie is about Bella Baxter, a fetus in the body of an adult woman in London who is saved from her mother's suicide through brain transplant and goes on a journey of self-discovery. The movie was released on December 8, 2023, in the United States and on January 12, 2024, in the United Kingdom, by Searchlight Pictures. It had strong positive reviews. It won four Academy Awards and two Golden Globe Awards (including Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy), with Stone winning Best Actress in both awards. Poor Things was the final Searchlight movie released on home video by 20th Century Home Entertainment before Disney switched it's home video business to Sony Pictures Home Entertainment. ==References== Category:2023 comedy movies Category:2020s black comedy movies Category:Movies based on books Category:Golden Globe Award winning movies Category:American erotic movies Category:American black comedy movies Category:Irish comedy movies Category:British black comedy movies Category:Hungarian movies Category:Movies set in London Category:Movies set in Portugal Category:Movies set in Egypt Category:Movies about prostitution Category:Movies directed by Yorgos Lanthimos Category:20th Century Fox movies Category:Movies featuring a Best Actress Academy Award-winning performance
title: Poor Things (movie)
